title: How to Make Rum Ice Cream

steps.headline: Place the cherries in a bowl and cover with rum.
steps.description: Allow to soak for several hours or overnight.

steps.headline: Heat the light cream and sugar together.
steps.description: Gently heat until the sugar is dissolved and bubbles begin to form around the edge of the pot.

steps.headline: Add ½ cup of the warm cream to the egg yolks.
Pour the warmed yolks back into the half-and-half and continue to cook, Stir constantly, until the custard mixture coats the back of a spoon.
steps.description: Do not boil the mixture or it will curdle.

steps.headline: Stir the mixture in vanilla.
steps.description: Allow to cool completely, then chill.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture in the ice-cream maker.
When the mixture begins to thicken as it freezes, add the cherries.
steps.description: Then freeze until the ice cream is the proper consistency.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Enjoy your homemade cherry ice cream!

text: Place the cherries in a bowl and cover with rum. Allow to soak for several hours or overnight. Heat the light cream and sugar together. Gently heat until the sugar is dissolved and bubbles begin to form around the edge of the pot. Whisk yolks until creamy.  Add ½ cup of the warm cream to the egg yolks.  Pour the warmed yolks back into the half-and-half and continue to cook, Stir constantly, until the custard mixture coats the back of a spoon. Do not boil the mixture or it will curdle. Stir the mixture in vanilla. Allow to cool completely, then chill. Pour the mixture in the ice-cream maker. Freeze according to manufacturer’s directions. Drain the cherries.  When the mixture begins to thicken as it freezes, add the cherries. Then freeze until the ice cream is the proper consistency. Serve. Enjoy your homemade cherry ice cream!
